definition: to cause no trouble/to be spared worry/worry-free
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department

sentences.english: However, children is not to let her worry and happiness.
sentences.chinese: 然而，兒女就是不讓她省心和幸福。

sentences.english: Excellent quality, perfect service, allows you to save money worry .
sentences.chinese: 過硬的質量，完善的服務，讓您省錢省心省事。

sentences.english: Mammy's service, provide more warmly professional service.
sentences.chinese: 園區保姆式服務，提供更省心的專業服務。

sentences.english: I decided to later must do a let parents worry of children.
sentences.chinese: 我決定以後一定要做個讓父母省心的孩子。

sentences.english: Lin mother saw home two men were not save worry, despair, blamed on them.
sentences.chinese: 林母見家裏的兩個男人都不省心，絕望的責怪起他們。

sentences.english: I have nothing to worry about in this life.
I've never said 2010 was going to be easy.
sentences.chinese: 我絕不會說2010年是個省心年。

definition: to feel relieved/to feel reassured/to be at ease
at ease/to feel relieved/to set one's mind at rest/to keep one's mind on sth
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
to do what one is told/obedient
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
